sanskrit_verse: एकोऽलुब्धस्तु साक्षी स्याद्बह्व्यः शुच्योऽपि न स्त्रियः । त्वसाक्षी स्त्रीबुद्धेरस्थिरत्वात्तु दोषैश्चान्येऽपि ये वृताः ॥ ८.७७॥
transliteration: eko 'alubdhas tu sākṣī syād bahvyaḥ śucyo 'pi na striyaḥ | tv asākṣī strī-buddher asthiratvāt tu doṣaiś cānye 'pi ye vṛtāḥ || 8.77 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One witness who is unattached alone suffices; many pure witnesses do not qualify if they are women. A woman is not a valid witness due to instability of intellect, nor others similarly compromised by defects.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from inner detachment and clarity, not numerical consensus
Causation in testimony depends on consciousness stability, not social category
Capacity-based responsibility requires absence of cognitive distortion or emotional entanglement
Restoration logic demands alignment with the unchanging witness-consciousness within
Consciousness alignment overrides gendered or categorical limitations when integrity is present
executable_legal_axioms: IF witness_count > 1 AND any_witness.gender == 'female' THEN validity_score -= 0.5 UNLESS integrity_stability_metric >= 0.9
IF witness.intellectual_stability < threshold THEN exclude_from_testimony ELSE include
IF witness.detachment_level == 'high' AND witness.integrity == 'confirmed' THEN witness_weight = 1.0
IF witness_group.contains_defect THEN group_validity = FALSE UNLESS purified_by_sattva_restoration
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the threshold of responsibility for testimonial evidence lies in the witness's capacity for stable cognition and detachment. Gender-based exclusion applies only where consciousness instability is indicated. Authority flows from the realization of the witnessing Self, not social identity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality locates truth in the clarity of the witness-consciousness. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that unstable cognition leads to misreporting, hence the sequential disqualification. Responsibility is proportional to the capacity for truthful perception. The non-punitive reality rule excludes defective cognition without devaluing the individual.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate consciousness stabilization protocol for excluded witnesses
Reintegrate disqualified individuals through sattvic purification practices
Assign supportive roles in dharma processes until capacity is restored
Ensure completion of prior unresolved testimonial distortions through corrective alignment
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored through alignment with the unwitnessed Witness. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
